DOCNAME: CASE OF Massimo ROSA v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of a flat in GPE , which had been let to GPE
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the applicant communicated his intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Rome Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Rome Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises must be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , he served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that he urgently required the premises as accommodation for himself .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant repossessed the premises .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
